cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then expected to slow and meander near or just inland before drifting slowly northeastward along the upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast between Port Mansfield and Sargent (near Corpus Christi/Port O'Connor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico; Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island, TX; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island, TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, including Galveston Bay and Houston Ship Channel
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are likely, with a 31% chance of sustained 50-kt winds and gusts possibly reaching minimal hurricane strength if the center drifts closer.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–4 ft above ground level possible in Galveston Bay and along the Houston Ship Channel under the current forecast. Higher values possible if landfall occurs farther north.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain with isolated amounts to 35 inches forecast for the upper Texas coast, causing life-threatening and disruptive flooding in the Houston metropolitan area and port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged port disruption due to stalling storm
